Title: The ANH will end this year with 26 oil and gas blocks awarded
Headline: In the hearing of counteroffers of the second cycle of the area auction, the ANH confirmed that 14 blocks will be awarded
Article: In the hearing of counteroffers of the second cycle of the auction of areas, the ANH confirmed that 14 blocks will be awarded. In line with the objective of the Government and the Ministry of Mines and Energy to reactivate the oil sector, the National Hydrocarbons Agency remains in the task of attracting investment from the sector to the country and to this end yesterday the hearing of counteroffers of this second round that is being carried out to deliver oil blocks was held, in which the companies had the opportunity to make counterproposals to the initial offers

Title: Anla stopped environmental license for fracking pilot
Headline: The decision was made based on the regulatory suspension of the Council of State
Article: The decision was made based on the regulatory suspension of the Council of State The National Environmental License Authority (Anla) suspended the process for the environmental license necessary to carry out the first fracking pilot in the country, designed to be developed between Puerto Wilches and Barrancabermeja , in Santander

Title: Anla stopped environmental license for fracking pilot
Headline: The decision was made based on the regulatory suspension of the Council of State
Article: Anla determined the suspension, through a letter sent to the president of the company, Felipe Bayón, based on the fact that the Council of State issued a decision last November with which regulations for fracking are provisionally suspended.

Title: Anla stopped environmental license for fracking pilot
Headline: The decision was made based on the regulatory suspension of the Council of State

Title: Anla stopped environmental license for fracking pilot
Headline: The decision was made based on the regulatory suspension of the Council of State
Article: Anla also indicated through the letter that although the rules that regulate environmental licensing in Colombia “are main, independent and autonomous,” they could not be applied “asynchronously” from those that authorize, regulate, establish or frame minimum technical procedures. , as is the case with fracking regulations

Title: Anla stopped environmental license for fracking pilot
Headline: The decision was made based on the regulatory suspension of the Council of State
Article: Previously, Anla had also suspended other licenses related to hydraulic fracturing, since in March of this year it requested that the procedures for the environmental licenses of two fracking projects of ConocoPhillips and Canacol Energy be archived, both located in the south of the department of Cesar.

Title: For the disposal process, Colombia analyzes the participation it has in 105 companies

Title: Equion Energía Limited returned $12,876 million to Ecopetrol due to tax ruling
Headline: Due to a fiscal responsibility ruling by the Comptroller's Office, the company compensated Ecopetrol for payment of drilling services that were not provided
Article: Due to a fiscal responsibility ruling by the Comptroller's Office, the company compensated Ecopetrol for payment of drilling services that were not provided. Thanks to the ratification of a fiscal ruling by the Comptroller General's Office of the Republic, the state oil company Ecopetrol recovered $12,876 million an unjustified payment to Equion Energía Limited, a company with which he had contracted the use of a drilling rig in the Piedemonte (Casanare) oil project

Title: Equion Energía Limited returned $12,876 million to Ecopetrol due to tax ruling
Headline: Due to a fiscal responsibility ruling by the Comptroller's Office, the company compensated Ecopetrol for payment of drilling services that were not provided
Article: The control body confirmed that for the exploration of the Floreña well, Equion, operator of the association contract signed with Ecopetrol, although it did comply with the obligation to contract the drill, left it inactive for seven months "without any justification", which generated “costs for its availability” to the company

Title: Equion Energía Limited returned $12,876 million to Ecopetrol due to tax ruling
Headline: Due to a fiscal responsibility ruling by the Comptroller's Office, the company compensated Ecopetrol for payment of drilling services that were not provided
Article: Likewise, the Comptroller's Office assured that Ecopetrol had to pay administration expenses that were already included in the contract rates and in relation to which it had no obligation, which would have generated patrimonial damage to the company, and therefore to the State

Title: Equion Energía Limited returned $12,876 million to Ecopetrol due to tax ruling
Headline: Due to a fiscal responsibility ruling by the Comptroller's Office, the company compensated Ecopetrol for payment of drilling services that were not provided
Article: Based on these facts, the Comptroller General, Carlos Felipe Córdoba, confirmed in the second instance the ruling with fiscal responsibility for these events, after which, the entity's Special Investigations Unit against Corruption proceeded to obtain payment for Ecopetrol, the which became effective on May 6, 2019

Title: Equion Energía Limited returned $12,876 million to Ecopetrol due to tax ruling
Headline: Due to a fiscal responsibility ruling by the Comptroller's Office, the company compensated Ecopetrol for payment of drilling services that were not provided
Article: Juliana Ramírez Bermeo, intersectoral delegate controller of said Unit, explained that Equion's payment was made in the name of the National Treasury, and that given that "the association contract that that company entered into with Ecopetrol is still in force, and one of the consequences of the declaration is the inclusion of those responsible in the Fiscal Responsibility Bulletin", if payment had not been made, they would be disqualified from contracting

Title: Equion Energía Limited returned $12,876 million to Ecopetrol due to tax ruling
Headline: Due to a fiscal responsibility ruling by the Comptroller's Office, the company compensated Ecopetrol for payment of drilling services that were not provided
Article: For its part, Equion also spoke out and assured that the payment referred to by the Comptroller's Office corresponds to a parking fee for the drill, a practice that according to the company "in addition to being widely used, allows reducing or redistributing the risks associated with the execution of hydrocarbon exploration and production projects, whose uncertainties are usually high”

Title: Equion Energía Limited returned $12,876 million to Ecopetrol due to tax ruling
Headline: Due to a fiscal responsibility ruling by the Comptroller's Office, the company compensated Ecopetrol for payment of drilling services that were not provided
Article: Finally, Equion assured that although it does not agree with the concept of the Comptroller's Office, the company has complied with the law and for this reason made the payment

Title: Comptroller General's Office recovered $12,876 million for fiscal damage caused to Ecopetrol
Headline: The company Equion Energía Limited had to recognize the sum for a drill that was not operating for seven months
Article: The company Equion Energía Limited had to recognize the sum for a drill that was not operating for seven months The Comptroller General of the Republic reported that, as a result of a fiscal damage that the company Equion Energía Limited generated to Ecopetrol, the control entity recovered $12,876 million after a ruling made firm by the head of the entity, Comptroller Carlos Felipe Córdoba

Title: Comptroller General's Office recovered $12,876 million for fiscal damage caused to Ecopetrol
Headline: The company Equion Energía Limited had to recognize the sum for a drill that was not operating for seven months
Article: The ruling for fiscal responsibility was ratified after the Special Investigations Unit against Corruption achieved full compensation for an "unjustified payment" that the state oil company had made to Equion Energía Limited for drilling services in the Piedemonte oil project.

Title: Comptroller General's Office recovered $12,876 million for fiscal damage caused to Ecopetrol
Headline: The company Equion Energía Limited had to recognize the sum for a drill that was not operating for seven months
Article: According to the control body, for the exploitation of the Floreña well, "the operator of the association contract signed with Ecopetrol contracted the use of a drill, which he left on standby for seven months, without any justification, causing costs for the availability of the same", a situation that led to the ruling in the first instance

Title: Comptroller General's Office recovered $12,876 million for fiscal damage caused to Ecopetrol
Headline: The company Equion Energía Limited had to recognize the sum for a drill that was not operating for seven months
Article: Likewise, the Comptroller's Office assured that Ecopetrol had to pay administration expenses that were already included in the contract rates and for which it had no obligation.

Title: Comptroller General's Office recovered $12,876 million for fiscal damage caused to Ecopetrol
Headline: The company Equion Energía Limited had to recognize the sum for a drill that was not operating for seven months
Article: Finally, Córdoba made this ruling final in the second instance and the company compensated the damages generated to the State by this contract.

Title: Comptroller General's Office recovered $12,876 million for fiscal damage caused to Ecopetrol
Headline: The company Equion Energía Limited had to recognize the sum for a drill that was not operating for seven months

Article: Thanks to the group of Colombians who decide to do business every day, generate employment and pay taxes, the country has achieved a minimum level of development that we must protect and support. More than a hypothesis of scientific work in the field of social sciences, it is a worthy assumption if proven: “thanks to the roles and functions of the private sector in Colombia, that is, the entrepreneurs and the thousands of people who set up businesses, generate jobs and pay taxes, the country has not fallen prey to the populism that has led to countries such as Venezuela and Nicaragua to be considered non-viable or failed states”

Title: The possible sale of ISA would leave the Government approximately $6.6 billion

Title: “Public companies, by decision, should be listed on the Stock Exchange”
Headline: The capital market turns 90 and the president of the BVC points out that the challenge is to get more players to participate
Article: The capital market turns 90 and the president of the BVC points out that the challenge is to get more players to participate. “Turning 90 years in itself is a great achievement,” says Juan Pablo Córdoba, president of the Colombian Stock Exchange. review the history of the local capital market that is now nine decades old

Title: “Public companies, by decision, should be listed on the Stock Exchange”
Headline: The capital market turns 90 and the president of the BVC points out that the challenge is to get more players to participate
Article: In dialogue with LR, the manager spoke about the main challenges faced by the industry, which has few issuers and investors, and pointed out that to create a virtuous circle that strengthens the market, it is necessary for the State to list its companies on the Stock Exchange.

Title: “Public companies, by decision, should be listed on the Stock Exchange”
Headline: The capital market turns 90 and the president of the BVC points out that the challenge is to get more players to participate
Article: RELATED ARTICLEThe local Stock Exchange began with a capital of $20,000 90 years ago. What is your assessment of the capital market that turns 90 years old? It's very positive

Title: “Public companies, by decision, should be listed on the Stock Exchange”
Headline: The capital market turns 90 and the president of the BVC points out that the challenge is to get more players to participate
Article: Turning 90 in itself is a great achievement, having survived the ups and downs of an economy and a country for 90 years is extraordinary and I believe that the last 15 years, since the creation of the Colombian Stock Exchange, the capitals has had an important development

Title: “Public companies, by decision, should be listed on the Stock Exchange”
Headline: The capital market turns 90 and the president of the BVC points out that the challenge is to get more players to participate
Article: We have had a development of the debt market, and the level of professionalism of the industry is extraordinary, and for better or worse the capital market has financed a large part of the growth process of companies in our country

Title: “Public companies, by decision, should be listed on the Stock Exchange”
Headline: The capital market turns 90 and the president of the BVC points out that the challenge is to get more players to participate
Article: It is true that there are many challenges, the size of the capital market we have seems small for the economy and we are convinced that we can do much more

Title: “Public companies, by decision, should be listed on the Stock Exchange”
Headline: The capital market turns 90 and the president of the BVC points out that the challenge is to get more players to participate
Article: Where will the market go in the future? In the last 20 years all financial activities have been based on technological issues, so when one looks forward the conversation is technological

Title: “Public companies, by decision, should be listed on the Stock Exchange”
Headline: The capital market turns 90 and the president of the BVC points out that the challenge is to get more players to participate
Article: As an institution we have stayed very up to date in recent years and we will continue to invest heavily in technology issues, at this time we are investing close to $20,000 million a year

Title: “Public companies, by decision, should be listed on the Stock Exchange”
Headline: The capital market turns 90 and the president of the BVC points out that the challenge is to get more players to participate
Article: We bought a company that helps the financial industry accelerate its innovation and technology adaptation process; We are investors in technology companies and it is today and will continue to be a development front for both the company, and the services we provide, as well as for the business.

Title: “Public companies, by decision, should be listed on the Stock Exchange”

Title: “Public companies, by decision, should be listed on the Stock Exchange”

Title: The good news of expensive oil and a high dollar
Headline: Almost always, when oil rises the dollar falls, on rare occasions both skyrocket, generating an avalanche of good income for countries that continue to depend on crude oil.

Title: After the Mission, more public assets could reach the capital market
Headline: How to promote schemes for small businesses has also been analyzed
Article: It has also been analyzed how to promote schemes for small businesses. Almost a month ago, the National Government, headed by the Ministry of Finance, designated the members who would be part of the Capital Market Expert Commission, who, among other things, have the task to look for alternatives to boost the current stock market and provide recommendations that improve the system with more investors and listed companies

Title: After the Mission, more public assets could reach the capital market
Headline: How to promote schemes for small businesses has also been analyzed
Article: Although the wise men are making a diagnosis of the current market, and not all of their proposals are yet known, the possibility of more State assets reaching the local stock market is being considered.

Title: After the Mission, more public assets could reach the capital market
Headline: How to promote schemes for small businesses has also been analyzed
Article: At the XII Congress of Asofondos, Julio Torres, one of the commissioners of the Mission, assured that at this moment the work is being carried out in a first stage in which the vision and interpretation of the participants in this segment is being collected.

Title: After the Mission, more public assets could reach the capital market
Headline: How to promote schemes for small businesses has also been analyzed
Article: Torres recalled that the commission is independent and pointed out that it is not being limited by considerations of implementation or political aspects, but rather the idea is that based on the diagnosis made and the presentation of the problems, a solution is delivered, a roadmap, to achieve an architecture that is optimal and that has a high probability of being implemented

Title: After the Mission, more public assets could reach the capital market
